data.title: #097: Dan O'Connor (Four Year Strong) by Two Week Notice
data.meta_description:
Dan O’Connor sings & plays guitar in Four Year Strong. On this episode, we discuss the formation of FYS, traveling & touring the world, his stint playing for Bury Your Dead, why FYS is stronger now than ever before, and more. Dan also answers fan questions. 


Follow Dan & Four Year Strong on Instagram: @danfys & @fouryearstrong


This episode is brought to you by The Jack Rack - hang your keys like a rockstar https://www.pluginzkeychains.com/ 

Ways to support the Two Week Notice Podcast:

-Subscribe
-Give a 5-star written review on the iPhone podcasts app
-Follow on Instagram: 
@danafuggenb
@twoweeknoticepodcast
data.text:
*Content Warning* Sensitive topics (including self-harm and suicide) are discussed during this episode between the 32:00 - 38:00 time stamps.

Ian Shelton is the frontman and vocalist of Militarie Gun. This interview was recorded in the Militarie Gun van while we were on tour together on June 16, 2024 in Buffalo, NY. Great talk!

Catch Militarie Gun on tour in Europe in August 2024 or supporting Manchester Orchestra (United States) in September 2024

Aaron Bedard is the frontman / vocalist of the Boston-based legendary hardcore band, Bane. On this podcast episode, Aaron and I discuss: selling merch, making a living by playing poker, touring with Saves The Day, playing shows in the 90's with other Massachusetts bands (Ten Yard Fight, Converge, Cave In, Piebald), Bane's formation and band history, he talks about Brendan "Stu" Maguire (bass player in Bane 2006-2012) and how his death in 2021 has left a lasting impact on Aaron's life - specifically the new friends and opportunities that all trace back to the legacy that Stu left behind.

Catch a very special evening with Bane (and very special guests) Sunday, June 18 @ Roadrunner in Boston, MA | Tickets & more info: ⁠⁠https://www.axs.com/series/17342/bane-tickets?skin=roadrunner

Jim Ward is the lead singer, guitar player, and frontman of the band, Sparta. Jim also is a founder of legendary post-hardcore band, At The Drive-In. On this podcast episode, we talk about Jim's musical upbringing and the scene in his hometown of El Paso, Texas. We also talk about starting ATDI when he was just 17 years old, and he goes into detail on getting fired by the band in 2016. Other topics: Sparta, selling merch, growing up straight edge in the El Paso scene, eventually "breaking edge", getting banned from being backstage while on tour with Weezer and Dashboard Confessional in 2002, meeting Dave Grohl, touring with Pearl Jam, and much more.

Catch Sparta on a world tour in 2023, featuring supporting acts: '68, Zeta, and Geoff Rickly | Tickets & more info: https://www.sparta.band/

Greg plays bass in the band Can't Swim. They just dropped a brand new record, "Thanks But No Thanks" in March of 2023 (links and more info below). This podcast interview took place during July 2022. Greg and I discuss: the tour we did together in April 2022 (The Story So Far, Joyce Manor, Mom Jeans, Microwave), filling in as a guitar player for Microwave at the last minute and playing in front of sold out crowds nightly, the formation of Can't Swim, signing to Pure Noise Records, sound checks, festivals, traveling, The Pine Barrens in New Jersey, and more.

Catch Can't Swim on tour in the United States supporting The Amity Affliction in May 2023 & catch them in the United Kingdom this summer with Microwave and Jetski | Tickets & more info: ⁠https://linktr.ee/cantswim

Dallas Taylor is a founding member and original vocalist of Underoath (1997-2003). He is also the frontman of Maylene And The Sons Of Disaster. On this episode, we discuss the music scene, coming up in central Florida and booking DIY shows, the start of Underoath, and why he eventually left the band in 2003, touring, eventually leading the start of his current band, Maylene And The Sons Of Disaster. From there, we discuss Maylene's new music, religion and beliefs, and throughout then whole episode we discuss the horrific ATV accident that almost took Dallas' life in 2016.

To provide insight on the injuries that Dallas suffered in his accident, here is a direct quote that Dallas posted on his Instagram page on 12/18/2016:

"On August 2nd I had a four wheeler accident. I Broke every bone in my face. Cracked my skull. Have a brain injury and bleeding on my brain.My face came apart from my skull in two places. Have a fully blocked carotid artery. Broke my arm really bad have plates now. Ripped my left ear down to the canal. The other ear has blood behind it so I can't hear well. Have blood on my lungs and lung atrophy from the ventilator and tracheotomy which causes my oxygen to be always low. Broke my upper and lower jaw had to have it wired shut. Had a trama stroke so I can't feel the right side of my face from that my teeth don't come together because of the weak muscle. Can't track left or right in my right eye and I can't produce tears in my eyes. I can't feel my eye either so I don't know when to blink and from no tears my vision is extremely blurry. Lost vision in my left eye for good. In a nutshell that's what happened..."

Dallas' links & socials:

Dallas' Instagram: @dallasttaylor

Maylene And The Sons Of Disaster Instagram: @matsod

https://linktr.ee/matsod

John LaCroix is a Boston hardcore legend. On this episode, we discuss: the formation and legacy of Ten Yard Fight, booking DIY shows in Boston in the mid-90s, coming up in the Merrimack Valley in Massachusetts with bands like Converge, Cave In, & Piebald, starting National Edge Day at their farewell show on 10/17/1999, the legend of kids in the hardcore scene selling "Yankees Suck" T-shirts, touring in Europe, traveling to Japan and Bangkok for martial arts tournaments, forming a band with the original lineup of what became the band Terror, his decision to no longer be "straight edge", and much more. This episode also features cameos from Jake Brennan (Cast Iron Hike, Disgraceland Podcast) and Kurt Ballou (Converge).

This conversation took place in June of 2022.

Follow John on Instagram: @iamjohnlacroix

Jamie Gordon played keyboards and percussion in The Constellations, and went on tour with acts such as: Snoop Dogg, Kurupt, Minus The Bear, and Jimmy Chamberlin (Skysaw / The Smashing Pumpkins). He played cowbell in Maylene & The Sons of Disaster. He is an active member of the elite Indie Drummer Collective. He runs has an amazingly entertaining, pandemic-born Instagram page called "Kid Kit Covers" where he posts videos of him playing drum covers on his kid's drum set. Jamie is from Birmingham, Alabama and has a legacy within the Birmingham music scene. He was in a band with Dallas Taylor (Maylene & The Sons of Disaster, former Underoath). On this episode, Jamie and I discuss all of these topics. We also do an in-depth recap of Furnace Fest 2022, we discuss bands we would like to see play Furnace Fest 2023, and much more.

Jamie's links / socials:

This episode was originally released on 9/14/2021, right before I hit the road with Piebald to head to Furnace Fest. This year, I'm heading to Furnace Fest again, but with the Two Week Notice Podcast! If you are in Birmingham, Alabama at this festival - be sure to stop by the TWN Podcast tent for free swag and giveaways. We are raffling off side-stage viewing for: New Found Glory, Maylene and the Sons of Disaster, and Mastodon.

Alex Garcia-Rivera is a legendary drummer, and a staple in the scene. Most notably, he plays drums in American Nightmare, and still plays in Bloodhorse. He has also has played drums in: Piebald, Saves The Day, Shelter, Good Clean Fun, 454 Big Block, Cold Cave, Kingpin, Get High, and more. He has also been a studio drum tech for: Converge, Mutoid Man, Jejune, Madball, In My Eyes, Four Year Strong, The Hope Conspiracy, Clouds - to name a few. Alex also performs all instruments in his solo project, Chrome Over Brass, and he is a recording engineer at Mystic Valley Studio in Medford, Massachusetts, which he also owns & operates.

On this podcast episode, Alex updates us on American Nightmare, talks about playing in Piebald, touring as a member of Saves The Day (including the Pop Disaster Tour opening for Green Day and Blink182), he talks about being a homeless musician, working through the challenges of playing drums with a rotator cuff injury, and breaks down how he writes and records songs with American Nightmare in his role as a drummer.

Alex's links & socials:

Alex's Instagram - @chromeoverbrass

American Nightmare Instagram: @weareamericannightmare

We are joined by Piebald frontman - Travis Shettel, and legendary record producer / engineer - Paul Kolderie (Q Division - Radiohead, The Pixies, The Mighty Mighty Bosstones, Dinosaur Jr.). This special episode entails a track-by-track breakdown of Piebald's album, "We Are The Only Friends We Have". Travis also shares insight into his lyrical perspective, and direct musical influences on his writing at the time of this record. Catch Piebald this Saturday, 6/4 at Sticks & Stones Fest in Worcester, Massachusetts - along with New Found Glory, Four Year Strong, Bayside, The Movielife, Be Well, A Loss For Words, and more.

Mike Schleibaum most notably plays guitar in the band Darkest Hour. He also plays in the band Be Well, is a music producer, and he even has a degree in social work. On this episode, Mike and I talk about his time working with Brian McTernan throughout his career, leading up to the formation on Be Well, his thoughts on being labeled a "super group", their upcoming tour with New Found Glory and Four Year Strong, and Be Well's brand new record, "Hello Sun"

Rama Mayo started a record label in high school, called Big Wheel Recreation, and worked with bands such as: Piebald, Say Anything, Jimmy Eat World, The Hives, At The Drive-In, Explosion, Jejune, The All-American Rejects, and many more. On this episode, we celebrate the 20 year anniversary for Piebald's album, "We Are The Only Friends We Have" and discuss Rama's crucial behind the scenes role which significantly contributed to the success of this record. We also talk about the early days of BWR, working with Max Bemis (Say Anything) and putting out the album, "Is A Real Boy", getting fired by Piebald & the shut down of BWR, and how Rama is applying his music business experience to his current career as the most successful cannabis marketer in America.

Brian Ward is a guitar tech for the band New Found Glory. On this episode, we discuss: coming up in the Syracuse scene, his time as a guitar tech for Unearth, Coheed & Cambria, Bayside, and NFG, a day in the life as a guitar tech, being on arena tours with bands like Slayer and Linkin Park across the globe, and more. Also this episode features the world premier of Brian's music project, Brian And The Wards. The full length album, "The Record No One Has Been Waiting For", will be out in a few months.

Brian And The Wards is:

Brian Ward - Guitar / Vocals
